column4: Rexnord to merge motion control unit with Regal Beloit in $3.69 billion deal
column5: (Reuters) - Rexnord Corp will merge its process and motion control (PMC) business with larger rival Regal Beloit Corp in a deal that values the unit at about $3.69 billion, the power transmission components makers said on Tuesday.
column6: The deal is tax-free for Rexnord shareholders because it is structured as a so-called Reverse Morris Trust, with Rexnord spinning off the unit and simultaneously merging it with Regal Beloit.
column7: Rexnordâ€™s PMC business makes power transmission components for industrial machinery and equipment, and expands a portfolio of similar products manufactured by Regal Beloit, the companies said in a joint statement.
column8: The deal, which will close in the fourth quarter of 2021, is expected to result in cost savings of $120 million within three years for Regal.
column9: Upon completion, Regal shareholders will own 61.4% and Rexnord shareholders 38.6% of the combined entity.
column10: Some of the industries served by the two companies include renewable energy, food and beverage, automation, aerospace, and e-commerce.
